title: Complex Employee Misconduct Case - Full Integration Test
description: Comprehensive test case with allegations involving harassment, fraud, and security violations requiring multi-department investigation

allegations.subject: John Doe (JD12345)
allegations.description: Multiple reports of inappropriate workplace behavior including unwanted advances and hostile work environment creation
allegations.narrative: The subject has been reported by multiple colleagues for creating an uncomfortable work environment through inappropriate comments, unwelcome physical contact, and making sexually suggestive remarks during team meetings. Three separate incidents have been documented over the past month.

allegations.subject: John Doe (JD12345)
allegations.description: Suspected falsification of expense reports and misuse of corporate credit card for personal expenses
allegations.narrative: Analysis of expense reports over the past 6 months shows suspicious patterns including duplicate receipts, inflated meal costs, and personal purchases charged to corporate accounts. Estimated financial impact of $15,000 in questionable expenses.

allegations.subject: John Doe (JD12345) and TechCorp Solutions
allegations.description: Unauthorized sharing of confidential client data with external vendor without proper authorization
allegations.narrative: Security logs indicate that confidential client financial data was accessed and transmitted to TechCorp Solutions without following proper data sharing protocols. The data includes customer PII and transaction records that should be restricted under our data classification policy.

narratives.title: Initial Report from Employee Hotline
narratives.narrative: On August 26, 2025, we received a complaint through our employee hotline regarding John Doe's conduct. The complainant, Jane Smith, reported that over the past month, Mr. Doe has engaged in inappropriate workplace behavior that has created a hostile work environment for her and other female colleagues. The complaint includes specific incidents of unwanted physical contact, sexually suggestive comments during team meetings, and persistent requests for personal meetings outside of work hours despite being declined multiple times.

narratives.title: Expense Report Anomalies Identified
narratives.narrative: During routine audit procedures, the Finance team identified several red flags in John Doe's expense reports submitted between February 2025 and August 2025. Key findings include: 1) Five instances of duplicate restaurant receipts submitted across different expense reports, 2) Unusually high meal expenses during periods when employee was working remotely, 3) Corporate credit card charges for electronics and personal items not related to business activities, 4) Expense report submissions that lack proper business justification or manager approval. Total questionable amount: $15,247.83.

narratives.title: Unauthorized Data Access and Transfer
narratives.narrative: CSIS monitoring systems detected unusual data access patterns on August 25, 2025. Investigation revealed that John Doe accessed the customer database containing sensitive PII and financial transaction data for 1,247 high-net-worth clients. This data was subsequently packaged and transmitted via encrypted email to TechCorp Solutions, an external vendor. Review of contracts and authorization records shows no valid business purpose or approved data sharing agreement for this transfer. This incident potentially violates data protection regulations including GDPR and local privacy laws. Immediate containment actions have been taken to secure the data and notify affected clients.
